snippet: The work of the professors, Eugene F. Fama, Lars Peter Hansen and Robert J. Shiller, shows that stock prices tend to follow established rules in the long term.
abstract: Professors Eugene F Fama, Lars Peter Hansen and Robert J Shiller share the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Science; their work shows that stock and bond prices move unpredictably in short term but tend to follow established rules in the long term; Fama believes in rational market, while Shiller does not.
lead_paragraph: The work of the professors, Eugene F. Fama, Lars Peter Hansen and Robert J. Shiller, shows that stock prices tend to follow established rules in the long term.

headline.main: Economists Clash on Theory, but Will Still Share the Nobel
headline.print_headline: Economists Clash on Theory, But Will Still Share the Nobel
